intro: Prosphysis tenella, commonly known as the slender orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, erect stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, delicate flowers in shades of white and pale yellow, often arranged in racemose inflorescences. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, often clustered at the base of the plant. Prosphysis tenella thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
